definition: feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)

sentences.english: He was always excited by his life and busy with where it was going.
sentences.chinese: 他總是爲他的生活而興奮，忙着它要去的地方。

sentences.english: I can happily say I've been off drugs for nearly a year now.
sentences.chinese: 我可以興奮地說我此刻快一年沒有沾過福壽膏了。

sentences.english: This is an intersting job, but kind of dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 這是一項令人興奮的工作，但有幾分危險。

sentences.english: I 'm very excited to hear Dr. Gambol 's talk.
sentences.chinese: 我很興奮能聽到甘博博士講話。

sentences.english: Please try, also, not to go totally freaking insane in the process.
sentences.chinese: 請嘗試，還有，不要在這個過程中保持極度興奮瘋狂。

sentences.english: Really wired to see a Dolphin pull-off that joke!
sentences.chinese: 看到海豚開這樣的玩笑真的很興奮。

sentences.english: That night, they are too excited to go to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 這一夜，兩人都興奮的失眠。

sentences.english: You could find this to be an exciting change of pace.
sentences.chinese: 這樣你會發現節奏會發生使你異常興奮的變化。

sentences.english: I can't, I can't do this. I'm so excited that I can't eat lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我實在太興奮了，以至於我都沒法喫午餐了。

sentences.english: Remember how excited you were when you built your first useful program?
sentences.chinese: 記得您在構建第一個有用的程序時是多麼興奮嗎？

sentences.english: He wakes up every morning filled with excitement and positive intentions.
sentences.chinese: 每天早上，他帶着興奮和積極地態度醒來。

sentences.english: I've never had alcohol before and was very excited.
sentences.chinese: 我之前從來沒沾過酒，所以很興奮。

sentences.english: Barking deliriously, the dog bounded towards his mistress .
sentences.chinese: 那隻狗興奮地狂吠着向女主人跑去。

sentences.english: The news enfevered the whole class.
sentences.chinese: 這消息令全班同學極度興奮。

sentences.english: There was an exciting football match on TV this evening.
sentences.chinese: 今天晚上電視播放了一場令人興奮的足球比賽。

sentences.english: She throbbed at the happy thought.
sentences.chinese: 這個美妙的想法讓她感到興奮。

definition: to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
to feel happy/to rejoice/to have a great time/to make fun of sb
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
